task.title: Offline Instance Migration to RHEL 7 Between NCs
task.shortdesc: This topic describes offline instance migration from a source NC to a destination NC, using the pack/unpack tool.

prereq.p: Before offline instance migration between NCs, ensure that:

ul.li: You understand the risks of offline migration between NCs, as described in .
You have successfully backed up your cloud state. See .
You have an available host machine for the destination NC.
If you are upgrading the destination NC, you need to migrate its instances before you upgrade to RHEL 7.
You are prepared for instances to be unavailable during the migration process.

context.p: In this offline migration scenario, you have installed on a new NC running RHEL 7, and then you migrate instances from the old NC.

The migration begins by suspending instances on the source NC running RHEL 6 and then packing their state to disk, creating an instance snapshot. The instance snapshot is then unpacked on the destination NC running RHEL 7.

p.b: To perform an offline instance migration to on RHEL 7

step.cmd: Upgrade the destination NC to RHEL 7.
step.info: See XREF TO Upgrade NC Host Machines to RHEL 7 and EUCA 4.3.

step.cmd: Pack the instance on the source RHEL 6 NC.

info.p: You have the option to pack all the instances on an NC or to choose a specific instance for migration. For example, you might want to move instances to different NCs in a separate migrations.
See XREF TO Pack Instances for Offline Migration.

step.cmd: Copy the packed file to the destination RHEL 7 NC.
Unpack the instance on the destination RHEL 7 NC.
step.info: See XREF TO Unpack Instances for Offline Migration.

result.p: The instance has now been migrated to on RHEL 7.
